distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for freeradius is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
FreeRADIUS is a high-performance and highly configurable free Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) server, designed to allow centralized authentication and authorization for a network.

Security Fix(es):

* freeradius: privilege escalation due to insecure logrotate configuration (CVE-2019-10143)

* freeradius: eap-pwd: Information leak due to aborting when needing more than 10 iterations (CVE-2019-13456)

* freeradius: eap-pwd: DoS issues due to multithreaded BN_CTX access (CVE-2019-17185)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.9 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: freeradius security and bug fix update

notes.text: It was discovered freeradius does not correctly configure logrotate, allowing a local attacker who already has control of the radiusd user to escalate his privileges to root, by tricking logrotate into writing a radiusd-writable file to a directory normally inaccessible by the radiusd user.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freeradius: privilege escalation due to insecure logrotate configuration
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, radiusd must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

Add `su radiusd:radiusd` to all log sections in /etc/logrotate.d/radiusd.

By keeping SELinux in "Enforcing" mode, radiusd user will be limited in the directories he can write to.

vulnerabilities.title: freeradius: privilege escalation due to insecure logrotate configuration

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: An information leak was discovered in the implementation of EAP-pwd in freeradius. An attacker could initiate several EAP-pwd handshakes to leak information, which can then be used to recover the user's WiFi password by performing dictionary and brute-force attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freeradius: eap-pwd: Information leak due to aborting when needing more than 10 iterations
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of freeradius as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, and 6 as they did not include support for EAP-pwd.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, radiusd must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: freeradius: eap-pwd: Information leak due to aborting when needing more than 10 iterations

cwe.name: Unsynchronized Access to Shared Data in a Multithreaded Context

notes.text: In FreeRADIUS 3.0.x before 3.0.20, the EAP-pwd module used a global OpenSSL BN_CTX instance to handle all handshakes. This mean multiple threads use the same BN_CTX instance concurrently, resulting in crashes when concurrent EAP-pwd handshakes are initiated. This can be abused by an adversary as a Denial-of-Service (DoS) attack.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freeradius: eap-pwd: DoS issues due to multithreaded BN_CTX access
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, radiusd must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: freeradius: eap-pwd: DoS issues due to multithreaded BN_CTX access
